intro: Dorstenia buchananii, commonly known as the banana tree of the genus Dorstenia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its elongated, fleshy leaves that often form a rosette. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique leaf morphology and ability to thrive in humid conditions. Dorstenia buchananii is also valued for its potential medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
